body:
> I know your description, but so what? If you think mixed role deployment fits you better. Just use it.

In my cases, i shift the skywalking performance three times by  stoping the aggregate node ,only run the receive node . Why there has so large performance improvement,because the aggregate action influence  ES writeing ability.
I shift the skywalking performance three times by stoping the aggregate node ,But aggregate  ability is needed
We don't take the responsibility of explaning the codes. You should read the codes by yourself.
I just tried the demo page, refreshing works.
This kind of description isn't helpful. This is like an LUA grammar issue.
I have the same confuse. How to change the context path of skywalking-ui?

> I have the same confuse. How to change the context path of skywalking-ui?

Off topic.
This is k8s API, read their documents.
@BFergerson Any update of this PR?
@kezhenxu94 Please recheck, I thin basically this is good.

I found the entry point (LambdaMetafactory class) base on this article [lambda-inspection](https://ruediste.github.io/bytecode/2017/02/25/lambda-inspection.html)
I will try to test in my local env and submit a PR
Yes, I agree it's better to config through backend command
Twitter about this feature, https://twitter.com/ASFSkyWalking/status/1301818654661595136
Also, you should add plugin tests for this feature, one on Spring, the other on Tomcat, through 2 ways of configuration.
Update to 8.1.0 also has this problem

> Also, you should add plugin tests for this feature, one on Spring, the other on Tomcat, through 2 ways of configuration.

will do it on weekend

@wu-sheng, I'm willing to fix this if I can run these tests necessary to confirm it works. However, I'm not even able to get the correct e2e tests to run successfully. These are the commands I'm using:
```sh
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/apache/skywalking.git
cd skywalking/
export SW_STORAGE=h2 && export SW_AGENT_JDK_VERSION=8 && export SKIP_TEST=true
make docker && ES_VERSION=es7 TAG=latest-es7 make docker.oap
cp -R dist test/e2e/
./mvnw --batch-mode -f test/e2e/pom.xml -am -DfailIfNoTests=false verify -Dit.test=org.apache.skywalking.e2e.profile.ProfileE2E
```

The issue I get is the same as the one I stated above. Are you able to run those commands successfully? What am I doing wrong?

---

Note, Lambda is also widely used in the rt.jar and many framework. I think the key point of this, we should only instrument user's lambda.
Sorry I'm late, here is another answer from the author of bytebuddy, just FYI https://stackoverflow.com/a/33912156/5200161

> Sorry I'm late, here is another answer from the author of bytebuddy, just FYI https://stackoverflow.com/a/33912156/5200161

Thanks for your help

> Note, Lambda is also widely used in the rt.jar and many framework. I think the key point of this, we should only instrument user's lambda.

Yes, I have no good idea about this, I think we should let user choose which package should be instrumented, is that ok ?

> > Note, Lambda is also widely used in the rt.jar and many framework. I think the key point of this, we should only instrument user's lambda.
> 
> 
> 
> Yes, I have no good idea about this, I think we should let user choose which package should be instrumented, is that ok ?  

That's a feasible option in the current agent design

> Note that this does only work with OpenJDK 8u40, in previous versions, there is a bug related to invokedynamic call sites that prevents this from working.

This makes me concern about feasibility in the real world. And you need `.with(LambdaInstrumentationStrategy.ENABLED)`, which can't be done through the plugin system. Do you have any idea/design about this?

@BFergerson my local environment is unavailable now because of the upgrade of Docker version, before I can make it work again, can you just add a breakpoint in `SkyWalkingAnnotations.java:211` and evaluate `dockerComposeFile` to see where the `NPE` came from
@BFergerson there is a bug in the E2E test when running locally, please `export GITHUB_RUN_ID=whatever` as well, and I'll ask the student who wrote this part to fix it soon
@codeglzhang just feel free to finish your examinations first and then coma back to this when you're available

The article @kezhenxu94 provider is too old, I am not sure if the latest version has any change,  I will test first to see how happened, anyway for this feature I think we should provider two property is agent config:
1. Enable lambda instrumentation switch (Yes/No)
2.Choose which package should be instrumented (List<String>)
Please don't instrument all lambda in any case. We at least require the package name.
I doubt JVM will change the class loader mechanism, in this case, lambda load mechanism. JVM load is usually defined in the Java specification.
@vipsql I didn't ask to trace the original RMI API, and a lot of that information wasn't available, so I did the tracing directly based on Spring RMI.

Personally, I prefer to provide a file watcher for agent, and the command system only provides a capability to update the dynamic config file.

This provides two capabilities at the same time, 
1. Could use backend configuration to update the configuration in batch(eg. all instance of a service)
1. Update one agent config manually.

Especially, terminal-based agent config update is safer in the product environment.

NOTE, not all configuration should support changing dynamically. They should be declared clearly, and if they are going to provide in the upstream release, they must be reviewed manually.
